#summary Use case 4: The ability to create a new Photo Hunt game. A 'game' is defined as a scavenger list of items to search for.

= Primary Actor =
    * Reviewer

= Preconditions =
    * Reviewer has a valid username and password to login to the web application.

=Postconditions =
    * A new Photo Hunt game has been created.

=Basic Flow=
   # Reviewer visits the Photo Hunt web application using their browser.
   # System displays the welcome page.
   # Reviewer clicks on the "Employees" link.
   # System goes to the login screen.
   # Reviewer enters their username and password.
   # System authenticates the user.
http://photohunt.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/use-cases/UC3_PictureReview_img1.jpg
   # Reviewer clicks on "Manage Photo Hunt games"
   # System displays a listing of current Photo Hunt games available
   # Reviewer clicks on "Create new Photo Hunt game"
   # System displays a form to enter in new game information.
   # Reviewer enters in the name for the new Photo Hunt game.
   # Reviewer enters in a description and keyword for a game item.
   # Repeat steps 11-12 until all game items have been entered.
   # Reviewer clicks on "Save game".
   # System saves the game.
   # System returns to the "Manage Photo Hunt games" page.

=Alternate Flows=
    * 6a. System fails to authenticate the user.
          # The system redirects the browser back to the login page. 
    * 14a. System reports null game name data.
	  # The system displays a warning to not leave the game name blank.
    * 14b. System reports empty game keyword data.
	  # The system displays a warning to not leave the game keyword blank.
    * 14c. System reports null game description data.
	  # The system displays a warning to not leave the game description blank.

=Special Requirements =
    * None 

=Frequency of Occurrence=
    * When a new exhibit goes on display 

=Open Issues=
    * May be best to use something like AJAX for this simple form data?
